info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 03 at 3:27PM EDT until July 03 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Nelson County in central Virginia... The City of Charlottesville in central Virginia... Central Albemarle County in central Virginia... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 327 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lowesville to 8 miles northwest of Schuyler to 8 miles north of Centenary, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Charlottesville, Crozet, Shipman, Schuyler, Wintergreen, Nellysford, Ivy, Scottsville, Esmont, Lovingston, North Garden, Covesville, Yancey Mills, Tyro, Flordon, Jonesboro, Scott Stadium, Faber, Massies Mill and Bryant. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
